intro: Capsicum longum var. rectum, commonly known as the bird's eye chili, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshade plants. The plant produces small, narrow, and pointed fruits that are typically 1–2 cm in length. The fruit has a thin, smooth skin and contains a high concentration of capsaicin, giving it a sharp, pungent heat. It is widely cultivated for its use in culinary and medicinal applications due to its unique flavor and active compounds.
